clinical_study.brief_title: Clinical Outcome After Anterior Cervical Decompression and Fusion and Cervical Total Disc Replacement
clinical_study.official_title: Clinical Outcome After Anterior Cervical Decompression and Fusion and Cervical Total Disc Replacement

brief_summary.textblock: The aim of this study is to examine the clinical outcome after anterior cervical decompression and fusion, and cervical disc prostheses in general. Additionally these two surgical methods for degenerative diseases of the cercival spine are analyzed comparatively in order to see whether one procedure should be preferred.

detailed_description.textblock:
The study population consists of patients who are suffering from neck and cervicobrachial pain because of degenerative diseases of the cervical spine. In that population conservative treatment such as analgesia and physiotherapy is no more sufficient, so that surgery is necessary. For surgical treatment are chosen either total disc replacement with an cervical disc prostheses or anterior cervical decompression and fusion.
In the context of this work the clinical success of these surgical methods should be analasied by means of the neck disability index (NDI), the visual analogue scale (VAS) in centimeter, clinical examinations, the satisfaction of patients with the surgery and the occurrence of adverse events. The included patients are examined and seen before and after the surgery.
Furthermore the two different methods are compared to each other in order to detect a possible advantage of one type of surgery.

primary_outcome.measure: Change in pain as assessed by VAS

secondary_outcome.description: Restrictions in patients' daily life objecitfied by the NDI (neck disabiliy index)

other_outcome.time_frame: postoperative until Follow up in 24 months
other_outcome.description: Adverse events as for example reoperation because of adjacent segment degeneration or implant loosening

other_outcome.measure: Change in pharmacological pain management, WHO Scale
other_outcome.description: Pain objectified by the analgesia scheme of the World Health Organisation

other_outcome.measure: Patient satisfaction with the surgical procedure
other_outcome.description: Satisfaction of patients with the result of the operation assessed by grades 1-6

arm_group.description: patients with anterior cerivical decompression and fusion
patients with cervical total disc replacement

intervention.description: Cervical Fusion is performed with a titanium cage (Company Peter Brehm, Weisendorf, Germany) and a plating system (Company Aesculap, ABC plating system, Tuttlingen, Germany)
The total disc replacement is performed with eiter a Freedom® Cervical Disc, AxioMed Spine Corporation, Garfield Heights, Ohio, USA or Active® C, Company, Aesculap, Tuttlingen, Germany

study_pop.textblock: Patients of the University Hospital of Bonn who are suffering from neck and cervicobrachial pain that cannot be treated anymore by conservative methods and have to undergo surgery such as cervical fusion or cevical disc arthroplasty.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- All patients who have to undergo surgery such as spondylodesis or disc prosthesis of the cervical spine because of degenerative diseases and who have been operated in the University Hospital of Bonn between 2011 and 2015.
Exclusion Criteria:
- Patients under the age of 18 years
- Pregnant women
- Patients who are not willing to participate in the study
- Patients unable to take part in the study because of any other known restriction or incompatibility
